instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange light on charger not starting
threads.message:
Hi
My second apple board is  a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a that is not starting
i have green light and orange right after
in smc bypass mode is starting and enters in os
i have noticed that when battery is connected  and i plug magsafe both fans are spinning but more like starting ,stopping and so on
  i would appreciate any sugestion where to start.
There is no liquid spill and no corrosion, only dust on mb .
THX

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange light on charger not starting
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange light on charger not starting
threads.message:
Are you using original 85W charger?
It charges battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange light on charger not starting
threads.message:
u are wright it is the power adapter.
i have used the original apple power adapter provided by owner.
it seems that they give-me the wrong adapter (a 45 watt one)
note to me  NEVER TRUST THE OWNER :)
THX
